PIONEER EXPERIENCES: A GENERAL QUESTIONNAIRE

NO. 2

Saskatchewan Archives Board

It is difficult to prepare a general questionnaire on pioneer life because no individual who has lived in Western Canada can be expected to have exactly the same experiences as another. Some of the questions here will not apply to your experiences; others may prove impossible for you to answer, so don't worry about leaving blank spaces. If the sheets of paper run out, you may continue on separate sheets or apply for a separate questionnaire.

This questionnaire is intended for persons who lived in Western Canada before 1914, but may be answered by anyone who has personal experience of the pioneer years whether born in this province or not.

If more than one member of the family can answer the questions, they should write them on separate sheets or apply for a separate questionnaire.

Other Questionnaires:

Saskatchewan Archives Questionnaire No. 1, entitled "Pioneer Diet: What Did Western Canadian Pioneers Eat?" is still being circulated. If you have not already answered this, and would be willing to do so, please put a check mark here ( ).

Saskatchewan Archives questionnaires on other subjects will be prepared at a later date. Some of these are listed below. Please mark the ones you would be willing to answer.

All questionnaires:

- Pioneer health conditions
- Pioneer social life, sports and recreation
- Pioneer education and churchwork
- Pioneer farming experience

Preservation of Questionnaires:

All questionnaires will be preserved in the Saskatchewan Archives Board's Office at the University of Saskatchewan as part of the permanent record of our Province. Please send your completed questionnaire to:

Saskatchewan Archives Office,
University of Saskatchewan,
Saskatoon, Sask.

SASKATCHEWAN PIONEER HERITAGE QUESTIONNAIRE

PIONEER EXPERIENCE: A GENERAL QUESTIONNAIRE

A YES OR NO QUESTIONNAIRE TO THE PERSON

SASKATCHEWAN'S PIONEER HERITAGE

It is difficult to prepare a general questionnaire on pioneer life because no individual who is asked to answer it has exactly the same experiences as another.

Some of the questions here will not apply to others may prove impossible for you to answer so don't worry about leaving blank spaces. If the question does not apply to you, simply write "N/A" in the space provided.

This questionnaire is intended for persons who lived in Western Canada before 1924 and may be answered by anyone who has personal experience of the Pioneer years whether born in this province or not.

If more than one member of the family can answer the questions, they should write them on separate sheets or reply for a separate questionnaire.

Other Questionnaires:

Saskatchewan Archives Questionnaire No. 1, entitled "Pioneer Diet: What Did Western Canadian Pioneers Eat?" is still being circulated. If you have not already answered this and would be willing to do so, please put a check mark here ( ).

Saskatchewan Archives questionnaires on other subjects will be prepared at a later date. Some of these are listed below. Please mark those you would be willing to answer.

All questionnaires:

- Pioneer health conditions
- Pioneer social life, sports and recreation
- Pioneer housing, land and churchwork
- Pioneer farming experiences

Preservation of Questionnaires:

All questionnaires will be preserved as part of the permanent record of the Saskatchewan Archives Board's Office at the University of Saskatchewan, Saskatoon.

Provision: Please send your completed questionnaire to:

Saskatchewan Archives Board
University of Saskatchewan
Gatineau, Quebec
